title: Magnetism and Magnetic Materials

vocab.kid_friendly_definition: An invisible force that can pull certain metals toward a magnet.
Materials that are attracted to magnets, like iron and steel.
The two ends of a magnet where the force is strongest.
When magnets pull things toward them.
When magnets push away from each other.
The area around a magnet where magnetic force can be felt.
A magnet made by electricity flowing through a wire.
Materials like iron that can be strongly attracted to magnets.

teachingNotes: Use various magnets and materials for hands-on testing. Demonstrate magnetic fields with iron filings. Connect to everyday uses of magnets.
